channel.title: What's wrong?

item.title: What's wrong?
item.dc:creator: @Anfernio Anfernio
item.description:
@Anfernio wrote:

On another topic

The variable ‘text’ in nonexistent.

Yet, without the code, as you can see, I have text.charAt(0)) and text.substring(1)); in existance, yet when I add the admin command, it says I doesn’t.

Read full topic

item.title: What's wrong?
item.dc:creator: @Anfernio Anfernio
item.description:
@Anfernio wrote:

I was coding shout, and I crossed an error. Without this code, else { if (playerRights == 2) { yell("[ADMIN]: " + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0)) + text.substring(1)); the error isn’t formed. With the code setup like this, although, if (command.startsWith("yell") && command.length() > 5) { String text = command.substring(5); yell(""+playerName+": " + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0)) + text.substring(1)); } else { if (playerRights == 2) { yell("[ADMIN]: " + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0)) + text.substring(1)); } }, I get this error: client.java:8140: cannot find symbol symbol : variable text location: class client yell("[ADMIN]: " + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0)) + text.substring(1)); ^ client.java:8140: cannot find symbol symbol : variable text location: class client yell("[ADMIN]: " + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0)) + text.substring(1)); ^ 2 errors Press any key to continue . . .

Without it: Press any key to continue . . .

May anyone post a fix?

Read full topic
